intro: Eriogonum orthocladon, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, small white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as hillsides and meadows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Eriogonum orthocladon plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various wildlife species.
